short_summary: A Marine Life Saving and Diving Equipment deposit Tenderskill Crate Game is being sought!
description: procure a marine life saving diving equipment.
full_summary:
**Title:** Dive Suits and Sensors Tender

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01004661
**Amendment Number:** 1
**Solicitation Number:** W8482-230678/A
**Publication Date:** August 18, 2022
**Closing Date:** September 20, 2022, 2:00 PM EST
**Status:** Expired

**Summary of Requirements:**
The Department of National Defence is seeking proposals for the provision of various dive suits and sensors. The following items are required:

* Diver's suits and associated parts (items 1-16, GSIN: N4220, NSN 4220-20-005-7167 to 4220-20-005-7176)
* Gas detectors (items 17-18, GSIN: N6665, NSN 6665-01-529-8960)

The required quantities and delivery locations for each item are specified in detail in the tender documentation.

**Trade Agreements:**
This tender is open to suppliers from Canada and eligible countries, in accordance with various trade agreements, including:

* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement

**Procurement Method:**
This is a competitive tender, open to all eligible suppliers.

**Selection Criteria:**
The selection criteria for this tender will be based on the tenderer's ability to meet the requirements specified in the tender documentation.

**Contact Information:**
For further information, please contact Michael Dettorre at [MICHAEL.DETTORRE@FORCES.GC.CA](mailto:MICHAEL.DETTORRE@FORCES.GC.CA) or refer to the tender documentation.

**Tender Documents:** 
The tender documentation, including the Request for Proposal (RFP), Amendment 1, and any other relevant documents, are available on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website. Only bids submitted in Canadian dollars will be accepted for consideration. Bidder's must indicate the brand name and model and/or Part Number and the NCAGE they are offering if proposing an Equivalent or Substitute Product.  
Documents can be presented in either official language of Canada.  Please note that the Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. 

Format your output with markdown
